org.apache.ambari.server.state.kerberos

Class KerberosServiceDescriptorFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.state.kerberos.KerberosServiceDescriptorFactory

  • public class KerberosServiceDescriptorFactory
extends Object
    KerberosServiceDescriptorFactory is a factory class used to create KerberosServiceDescriptor instances using various sources of data.

    • Method Detail

      • createInstances

        public KerberosServiceDescriptor[] createInstances(File file)
                                            throws IOException
        Creates a Collection of KerberosServiceDescriptors parsed from a JSON-formatted file.

        The file is expected to be formatted as follows: 

         {
    "services" : [
      ... (zero or more service descriptor blocks) ...
    ]
 }
        Parameters:
        file - a JSON-formatted file containing this service-level descriptor data
        Returns:
        an array of KerberosServiceDescriptor objects
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the specified File does not point to a valid file
        IOException - if the specified File is not a readable file
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if the specified File does not contain valid JSON data
        See Also:
        KerberosServiceDescriptor

      • createInstances

        public KerberosServiceDescriptor[] createInstances(String json)
                                            throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Creates a Collection of KerberosServiceDescriptors parsed from a JSON-formatted String.

        The String is expected to be formatted as follows: 

         {
    "services" : [
      ... (zero or more service descriptor blocks) ...
    ]
 }
        Parameters:
        json - a JSON-formatted String containing this service-level descriptor data
        Returns:
        an array of KerberosServiceDescriptor objects
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while processing the JSON-formatted String
        See Also:
        KerberosServiceDescriptor

      • createInstances

        public KerberosServiceDescriptor[] createInstances(Map<String,Object> map)
                                            throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Creates a Collection of KerberosServiceDescriptors parsed from a Map of data.

        The Map is expected to be formatted as follows: 

         "services" => [
   ... (zero or more Maps containing service descriptor data) ...
 ]
        Parameters:
        map - a Map containing this service-level descriptor data
        Returns:
        an array of KerberosServiceDescriptor objects
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while processing the Map
        See Also:
        KerberosServiceDescriptor

      • createInstance

        public KerberosServiceDescriptor createInstance(File file,
                                                String name)
                                         throws IOException
        Creates the requested KerberosServiceDescriptor parsed from a JSON-formatted file.

        The file is expected to be formatted as follows: 

         {
    "services" : [
      ... (zero or more service descriptor blocks) ...
    ]
 }

        Because of this one or more services may exist. This method parses through the definitions to return the a KerberosServiceDescriptor for the requested service

        Parameters:
        file - a JSON-formatted file containing this service-level descriptor data
        name - a String containing the nae of the desired service
        Returns:
        a KerberosServiceDescriptor object or null if a descriptor for the named service is not available
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the specified File does not point to a valid file
        IOException - if the specified File is not a readable file
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if the specified File does not contain valid JSON data
        See Also:
        KerberosServiceDescriptor

      • createInstance

        public KerberosServiceDescriptor createInstance(Map<String,Object> map,
                                                String name)
                                         throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Creates the requested KerberosServiceDescriptor parsed from a Map of data.

        The Map is expected to be formatted as follows: 

         "services" => [
   ... (zero or more Maps containing service descriptor data) ...
 ]

        Because of this one or more services may exist. This method parses through the definitions to return the a KerberosServiceDescriptor for the requested service

        Parameters:
        map - a Map containing this service-level descriptor data
        name - a String containing the nae of the desired service
        Returns:
        a KerberosServiceDescriptor object or null if a descriptor for the named service is not available
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while processing the Map
        See Also:
        KerberosServiceDescriptor

      • createInstance

        public KerberosServiceDescriptor createInstance(String name,
                                                String json)
                                         throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Creates a new KerberosServiceDescriptor
        Parameters:
        name - a String declaring this service's name
        json - a JSON-formatted String containing this service's descriptor data
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while parsing the JSON-formatted String
        See Also:
        KerberosServiceDescriptor

      • createInstance

        public KerberosServiceDescriptor createInstance(String name,
                                                Map<?,?> map)
                                         throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Creates a new KerberosServiceDescriptor
        Parameters:
        name - a String declaring this service's name
        map - a Map of values use to populate the data for the new instance
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if an error occurs while parsing the JSON-formatted String
        See Also:
        KerberosServiceDescriptor

      • parseFile

        protected Map<String,Object> parseFile(File file)
                                throws IOException
        Parses a file containing JSON-formatted text into a (generic) Map.
        Parameters:
        file - a File containing the JSON-formatted text to parse
        Returns:
        a Map of the data
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the specified File does not point to a valid file
        IOException - if the specified File is not a readable file
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if the specified File does not contain valid JSON data
